entities.name: disc
entities.description: The game equipment used in Ultimate, must be acceptable to both team captains

entities.name: pivot
entities.description: The specific point of contact with the ground that a thrower must maintain when in possession

entities.name: marker
entities.description: Defensive player within 10 feet of the thrower who may initiate a stall count

entities.name: stall count
entities.description: 10-second countdown initiated by marker to limit time thrower can hold disc

entities.name: pull
entities.description: The throw from one team to the other that starts play after a point or half

entities.name: turnover
entities.description: When possession changes from one team to the other due to incomplete pass or violation

entities.name: travel
entities.description: When thrower fails to maintain pivot or moves illegally with disc

entities.name: pick
entities.description: When offensive player obstructs defender's path to player they are guarding

entities.name: strip
entities.description: When a foul causes a player to lose possession of the disc

relationships.name: causes turnover
relationships.description: When one event directly results in a change of possession
relationships.example: An incomplete pass causes a turnover

relationships.name: stops play
relationships.description: When an action requires play to halt until resolved
relationships.example: A foul call stops play until resolved

relationships.name: requires
relationships.description: When one thing is necessary for another to occur
relationships.example: A marker requires being within 10 feet to initiate stall count

relationships.name: prevents
relationships.description: When one thing makes another thing illegal or invalid
relationships.example: A pick prevents defender from guarding their player

relationships.name: resets
relationships.description: When one event causes another to start over
relationships.example: A marking violation resets the stall count
